description: A Bundle is a collection of arbitrary STIX Objects and Marking Definitions grouped together in a single container.
title: bundle

___type.description: The type of this object, which MUST be the literal `bundle`.

___spec_version.description: The version of the STIX specification used to represent the content in this bundle.

___objects.description: Specifies a set of one or more STIX Objects.

___name.description: The name used to identify the Attack Pattern.

___kill_chain_phases.description: The list of kill chain phases for which this attack pattern is used.

___description.description: A description that provides more details and context about the Attack Pattern, potentially including its purpose and its key characteristics.

___type.description: The type of this object, which MUST be the literal `attack-pattern`.

$eref.description: Attack Patterns are a type of TTP that describe ways that adversaries attempt to compromise targets.
$eref.title: attack-pattern

___name.description: The name used to identify the Campaign.

___description.description: A description that provides more details and context about the Campaign, potentially including its purpose and its key characteristics.

___type.description: The type of this object, which MUST be the literal `campaign`.

___objective.description: This field defines the Campaign’s primary goal, objective, desired outcome, or intended effect.

___aliases.description: Alternative names used to identify this campaign.

___first_seen.description: The time that this Campaign was first seen.

___last_seen.description: The time that this Campaign was last seen.

$eref.description: A Campaign is a grouping of adversary behavior that describes a set of malicious activities or attacks that occur over a period of time against a specific set of targets.
$eref.title: campaign

___name.description: The name used to identify the Course of Action.

___description.description: A description that provides more details and context about this object, potentially including its purpose and its key characteristics.

___type.description: The type of this object, which MUST be the literal `course-of-action`.

$eref.description: A Course of Action is an action taken either to prevent an attack or to respond to an attack that is in progress.
$eref.title: course-of-action

___description.description: A description that provides more details and context about the Identity.

___type.description: The type of this object, which MUST be the literal `identity`.

___contact_information.description: The contact information (e-mail, phone number, etc.) for this Identity.

___sectors.description: The list of sectors that this Identity belongs to. Open Vocab - industry-sector-ov

___identity_class.description: The type of entity that this Identity describes, e.g., an individual or organization. Open Vocab - identity-class-ov

___labels.description: The list of roles that this Identity performs (e.g., CEO, Domain Administrators, Doctors, Hospital, or Retailer). No open vocabulary is yet defined for this property.

$eref.description: Identities can represent actual individuals, organizations, or groups (e.g., ACME, Inc.) as well as classes of individuals, organizations, or groups.
$eref.title: identity

___name.description: The name used to identify the Indicator.

___kill_chain_phases.description: The phases of the kill chain that this indicator detects.

___valid_from.description: The time from which this indicator should be considered valuable intelligence.

___description.description: A description that provides the recipient with context about this Indicator potentially including its purpose and its key characteristics.

___type.description: The type of this object, which MUST be the literal `indicator`.

___labels.description: This field is an Open Vocabulary that specifies the type of indicator. Open vocab - indicator-label-ov

___valid_until.description: The time at which this indicator should no longer be considered valuable intelligence.

___pattern.description: The detection pattern for this indicator. The default language is STIX Patterning.

$eref.description: Indicators contain a pattern that can be used to detect suspicious or malicious cyber activity.
$eref.title: indicator

___name.description: The name used to identify the Intrusion Set.

___description.description: Provides more context and details about the Intrusion Set object.

___type.description: The type of this object, which MUST be the literal `intrusion-set`.

___resource_level.description: This defines the organizational level at which this Intrusion Set typically works. Open Vocab - attack-resource-level-ov

___secondary_motivations.description: The secondary reasons, motivations, or purposes behind this Intrusion Set. Open Vocab - attack-motivation-ov

___goals.description: The high level goals of this Intrusion Set, namely, what are they trying to do.

___aliases.description: Alternative names used to identify this Intrusion Set.

___first_seen.description: The time that this Intrusion Set was first seen.

___primary_motivation.description: The primary reason, motivation, or purpose behind this Intrusion Set. Open Vocab - attack-motivation-ov

___last_seen.description: The time that this Intrusion Set was last seen.

$eref.description: An Intrusion Set is a grouped set of adversary behavior and resources with common properties that is believed to be orchestrated by a single organization.
$eref.title: intrusion-set

___name.description: The name used to identify the Malware.

___kill_chain_phases.description: The list of kill chain phases for which this Malware instance can be used.

___description.description: Provides more context and details about the Malware object.

___type.description: The type of this object, which MUST be the literal `malware`.

___labels.description: The type of malware being described. Open Vocab - malware-label-ov

$eref.description: MMalware is a type of TTP that is also known as malicious code and malicious software, refers to a program that is inserted into a system, usually covertly, with the intent of compromising the confidentiality, integrity, or availability of the victim's data, applications, or operating system (OS) or of otherwise annoying or disrupting the victim.
$eref.title: malware

___definition.description: The definition property contains the marking object itself.

___definition_type.description: The definition_type property identifies the type of Marking Definition.

___definition.description: The definition property contains the marking object itself.

___definition_type.description: The definition_type property identifies the type of Marking Definition.

___definition.description: The definition property contains the marking object itself.

___definition_type.description: The definition_type property identifies the type of Marking Definition.

$eref.description: The marking-definition object represents a specific marking.
$eref.title: marking-definition

_88tlp.description: The TLP marking type defines how you would represent a Traffic Light Protocol (TLP) marking in a definition field.

___tlp.description: The TLP level of the content marked by this marking definition, as defined in this section.

_88statement.description: The Statement marking type defines the representation of a textual marking statement (e.g., copyright, terms of use, etc.) in a definition

___statement.description: A statement (e.g., copyright, terms of use) applied to the content marked by this marking definition.

___created_by_ref.description: The created_by_ref property specifies the ID of the identity object that describes the entity that created this Marking Definition.

___type.description: The type of this object, which MUST be the literal `marking-definition`.

___granular_markings.description: The granular_markings property specifies a list of granular markings applied to this object.

___object_marking_refs.description: The object_marking_refs property specifies a list of IDs of marking-definition objects that apply to this Marking Definition.

___external_references.description: A list of external references which refers to non-STIX information.

___created.description: The created property represents the time at which the first version of this Marking Definition object was created.

___last_observed.description: The end of the time window that the data was observed during.

___type.description: The type of this object, which MUST be the literal `observed-data`.

___number_observed.description: The number of times the data represented in the objects property was observed. This MUST be an integer between 1 and 999,999,999 inclusive.

___first_observed.description: The beginning of the time window that the data was observed during.

___type.description: Indicates that this object is a custom Observable Object.

___objects.description: A dictionary of Cyber Observable Objects that describes the single 'fact' that was observed.

$eref.description: Observed data conveys information that was observed on systems and networks, such as log data or network traffic, using the Cyber Observable specification.
$eref.title: observed-data

___source_ref.description: The ID of the source (from) object.

___description.description: A description that helps provide context about the relationship.

___relationship_type.description: The name used to identify the type of relationship.

___type.description: The type of this object, which MUST be the literal `relationship`.

___target_ref.description: The ID of the target (to) object.

$eref.description: The Relationship object is used to link together two SDOs in order to describe how they are related to each other.
$eref.title: relationship

___name.description: The name used to identify the Report.

___description.description: A description that provides more details and context about Report.

___type.description: The type of this object, which MUST be the literal `report`.

___object_refs.description: Specifies the STIX Objects that are referred to by this Report.

___labels.description: This field is an Open Vocabulary that specifies the primary subject of this report. The suggested values for this field are in report-label-ov.

___published.description: The date that this report object was officially published by the creator of this report.

$eref.description: Reports are collections of threat intelligence focused on one or more topics, such as a description of a threat actor, malware, or attack technique, including context and related details.
$eref.title: report

___count.description: This is an integer between 0 and 999,999,999 inclusive and represents the number of times the object was sighted.

___type.description: The type of this object, which MUST be the literal `sighting`.

___sighting_of_ref.description: An ID reference to the object that has been sighted.

___observed_data_refs.description: A list of ID references to the Observed Data objects that contain the raw cyber data for this Sighting.

___summary.description: The summary property indicates whether the Sighting should be considered summary data.

___where_sighted_refs.description: The ID of the Victim Target objects of the entities that saw the sighting.

___first_seen.description: The beginning of the time window during which the SDO referenced by the sighting_of_ref property was sighted.

___last_seen.description: The end of the time window during which the SDO referenced by the sighting_of_ref property was sighted.

$eref.description: A Sighting denotes the belief that something in CTI (e.g., an indicator, malware, tool, threat actor, etc.) was seen.
$eref.title: sighting

___type.description: The type of this object, which MUST be the literal `threat-actor`.

___resource_level.description: This defines the organizational level at which this Threat Actor typically works. Open Vocab - attack-resource-level-ov

___roles.description: This is a list of roles the Threat Actor plays. Open Vocab - threat-actor-role-ov

___secondary_motivations.description: The secondary reasons, motivations, or purposes behind this Threat Actor. Open Vocab - attack-motivation-ov

___labels.description: This field specifies the type of threat actor. Open Vocab - threat-actor-label-ov

___aliases.description: A list of other names that this Threat Actor is believed to use.

___name.description: A name used to identify this Threat Actor or Threat Actor group.

___description.description: A description that provides more details and context about the Threat Actor.

___personal_motivations.description: The personal reasons, motivations, or purposes of the Threat Actor regardless of organizational goals. Open Vocab - attack-motivation-ov

___goals.description: The high level goals of this Threat Actor, namely, what are they trying to do.

___sophistication.description: The skill, specific knowledge, special training, or expertise a Threat Actor must have to perform the attack. Open Vocab - threat-actor-sophistication-ov

___primary_motivation.description: The primary reason, motivation, or purpose behind this Threat Actor. Open Vocab - attack-motivation-ov

$eref.description: Threat Actors are actual individuals, groups, or organizations believed to be operating with malicious intent.
$eref.title: threat-actor

___name.description: The name used to identify the Tool.

___kill_chain_phases.description: The list of kill chain phases for which this Tool instance can be used.

___description.description: Provides more context and details about the Tool object.

___type.description: The type of this object, which MUST be the literal `tool`.

___labels.description: The kind(s) of tool(s) being described. Open Vocab - tool-label-ov

___tool_version.description: The version identifier associated with the tool.

$eref.description: Tools are legitimate software that can be used by threat actors to perform attacks.
$eref.title: tool

___name.description: The name used to identify the Vulnerability.

___description.description: A description that provides more details and context about the Vulnerability.

___type.description: The type of this object, which MUST be the literal `vulnerability`.

$eref.description: A Vulnerability is a mistake in software that can be directly used by a hacker to gain access to a system or network.
$eref.title: vulnerability

$eref.description: Common properties and behavior across all STIX Domain Objects and STIX Relationship Objects.
$eref.title: core

___created_by_ref.description: The ID of the Source object that describes who created this object.

___type.description: The type property identifies the type of STIX Object (SDO, Relationship Object, etc). The value of the type field MUST be one of the types defined by a STIX Object (e.g., indicator).
___type.title: type

___granular_markings.description: The set of granular markings that apply to this object.

___object_marking_refs.description: The list of marking-definition objects to be applied to this object.

___revoked.description: The revoked property indicates whether the object has been revoked.

___external_references.description: A list of external references which refers to non-STIX information.

___labels.description: The labels property specifies a set of classifications.

___modified.description: The modified property represents the time that this particular version of the object was created.

___created.description: The created property represents the time at which the first version of this object was created.

___id.description: The id property universally and uniquely identifies this object.

___type.description: The type of this object, which for custom objects cannot be one of those defined in the specification.

$eref.description: Represents identifiers across the CTI specifications. The format consists of the name of the top-level object being identified, followed by two dashes (--), followed by a UUIDv4.
$eref.title: identifier

allOf.description: An identifier for this bundle. The id field for the Bundle is designed to help tools that may need it for processing, but tools are not required to store or track it.
